snippet: The increase, reported by the Federal Reserve, hints at rising consumer demand. In a separate report, jobless claims slipped to a 15-year low.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports that consumer borrowing expanded by $20.5 billion in March, to record of $3.36 trillion; Labor Dept reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits rose 3,000 to 265,000.
lead_paragraph: The increase, reported by the Federal Reserve, hints at rising consumer demand. In a separate report, jobless claims slipped to a 15-year low.

headline.main: Consumer Borrowing Rises by $20.5 Billion, Biggest Jump Since April 2014
